results.name: Triangle read by rows: the reversed x = 1+q Narayana triangle at m=3.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..11325
Paul Barry, On the inversion of Riordan arrays, arXiv:2101.06713 [math.CO], 2021.
J.-C. Novelli, J.-Y. Thibon, Hopf Algebras of m-permutations,(m+1)-ary trees, and m-parking functions, arXiv preprint arXiv:1403.5962, 2014. See Fig. 11.
formula: T(n,k) = binomial(4*n+1-k,n-k) * binomial(n,k-1) / n for 1 <= k <= n, more generally: T_m(n,k) = binomial((m+1)*n+1-k,n-k) * binomial(n,k-1) / n for 1 <= k <= n and some fixed integer m > 1. - _Werner Schulte_, Nov 22 2018
mathematica: T[m_][n_, k_] := Binomial[(m + 1) n + 1 - k, n - k] Binomial[n, k - 1]/n;
Table[T[3][n, k], {n, 1, 9}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 12 2019 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 13 2014
